title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Entities tied to WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann have acquired majority stakes valued at more than $1 billion in apartment buildings in several U.S. cities.

The Dow gained 0.6% to close at a record, but the Nasdaq and S&P 500 lost 1.3% and 0.06%, respectively, amid a decline in tech shares.

OPEC and a coalition of Russia-led oil producers agreed to continue pumping more crude, a decision that pushed oil prices higher.

Walmart and Kroger are raising prices for BinaxNow rapid Covid-19 tests after the expiration of a deal with the White House to sell the home-use kits at cost for $14.

Property developer Evergrande said it had been ordered to tear down dozens of buildings on a man-made island in southern China.

TPG launched its roadshow pitch to investors, seeking a valuation as high as $9.5 billion in its IPO.

What's News: Business & Finance
